result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Pierre M Mccoy

defendant.name: Mccoy, Pierre M
defendant.address: 1430 Six Points Crossing, #401, West Allis, WI 53214

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. Jury Instruction - Disorderly Conduct
Received and Filed. Jury Instruction - Battery
Received and Filed. Deferred Prosecution Agreement

Defendant Pierre M Mccoy appeared by video.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl appeared by video for Pierre M Mccoy.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Defense bail motion held.  Arguments heard.  For reasons stated on the record, Court will allow thrid party contact for the child.  Defense counsel requests DPA Hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Pierre M Mccoy appeared by video.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl appeared by video for Pierre M Mccoy.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel was recently appointed and requests bail review on no contact order.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail bond previously posted to be returned to remitter.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JAJ.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Pierre M Mccoy in court. Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant advised that this case is re-assigned to Judge Skwierawski, Branch 41.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 41 for a Pretrial Conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 9/6/22 @ 1p
